article.headline: Nvidia surpasses Intel as largest U.S. chip maker by market cap
article.body: Nvidia Corp. NVDA, -0.54% surpassed Intel Corp. INTC, -1.03% as the largest U.S. chip maker by market cap for the first time on Wednesday. Nvidia shares closed up 3.5% at $408.64, giving it a market cap of $251.31 billion, while Intel shares finished up 0.5% at $58.61, giving it a market cap of $248.16 billion, according to FactSet data. For the year, Nvidia shares have gained 74% while Intel shares have slipped 2%, compared with a 11% gain in the PHLX Semiconductor Index SOX, +1.77%, a 17% gain in the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, +1.39%, and a 1.9% decline in the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.87%. While it is not the first time a U.S. chip maker has surpassed Intel in market cap, it is the first time for Nvidia. Back in 1999 and 2000, Texas Instruments Inc. TXN, +1.92% surpassed Intel in cap a few times, and between late 2012 and mid-2014 Qualcomm Inc. QCOM, +2.06% and Intel often jockeyed for the No. 1 position, according to Dow Jones data.
